member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverReadAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a PLC tag to read when an event is triggered. The tag is read ONCE when the event is emitted, not continuously polled.
member.remarks: Use this attribute on event handlers (classes with [Event] attribute) to automatically read PLC tags before the handler is invoked. The values are available in TagReadResults.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverReadAttribute.Elements
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of array elements to read. Only applicable for array tags. Default is 1.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverReadAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the PLC driver (e.g., "plc1").
The name of the PLC tag to read.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverReadAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an explicit value type.
member.param: The name of the PLC driver (e.g., "plc1").
The name of the PLC tag to read.
The expected type of the tag value.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.TagSubscriptionMode
member.summary: Subscription mode for PLC tag monitoring.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.TagSubscriptionMode.Polling
member.summary: Polling mode: Tag value is read at regular intervals (default). More CPU efficient for the PLC, suitable for most scenarios.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.TagSubscriptionMode.Unsolicited
member.summary: Unsolicited mode: PLC pushes value changes immediately. Lower latency but higher PLC overhead. Requires PLC support.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute
member.summary: Marks a message handler class to subscribe to PLC tag changes via Edge PLC Driver. Multiple attributes can be applied to subscribe to multiple tags.
member.remarks: Tag Name Examples: - "MyTag" - Simple tag in controller scope - "Program:MainProgram.MyTag" - Program-scoped tag - "MyArray[0]" - Array element - "MyUDT.Member" - UDT member access

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute.PollingIntervalMs
member.summary: Gets or sets the polling interval in milliseconds for this specific tag. If not set, uses the connection's default polling interval.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the Edge PLC Driver data type for the tag. If not specified, the type is inferred from the message type.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute.OnChangeOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to trigger handler only on value change (true) or on every poll cycle (false).

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute.Deadband
member.summary: Gets or sets the deadband for analog values. Handler is only triggered if value changes by more than this amount. Only applicable when OnChangeOnly is true.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the subscription mode (Polling or Unsolicited). Polling (default): Tag is read at regular intervals. Unsolicited: PLC pushes value changes immediately (lower latency, higher PLC overhead).

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverSubscribeAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.TagSubscriptionMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the Edge PLC Driver to use. Must match a configured driver name.
The PLC tag name to subscribe to.
Optional polling interval in milliseconds. Uses driver default if not specified.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Attributes.EdgePlcDriverDataType

member.summary: Unsigned 16-bit integer (UINT)

member.summary: Unsigned 32-bit integer (UDINT)

member.summary: Unsigned 64-bit integer (ULINT)

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.ConduitBuilderEdgePlcDriverExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for adding Edge PLC Driver connections to ConduitBuilder.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.ConduitBuilderEdgePlcDriverExtensions.AddEdgePlcDriver(Conduit.Core.ConduitBuilder,System.Action{Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriverBuilder})
member.summary: Adds an Edge PLC Driver connection to the Conduit builder.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.ConduitBuilderEdgePlcDriverExtensions.AddEdgePlcDriver(Conduit.Core.ConduitBuilder,System.String,System.Action{Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriverBuilder})
member.summary: Adds an Edge PLC Driver connection with a specific connection name.
member.param: The logical name for this driver.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.ConduitBuilderEdgePlcDriverExtensions.AddEdgePlcDriver(Conduit.Core.ConduitBuilder,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an Edge PLC Driver connection with minimal configuration.
member.param: The logical name for this driver.
The IP address of the PLC.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for an Edge PLC Driver connection.
member.remarks: Supports Allen-Bradley PLC families: - ControlLogix - CompactLogix - GuardPLC - SoftLogix - Micro800

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.ConnectionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical name of this driver. Used to match handlers decorated with [EdgePlcDriverSubscribe] to this driver.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.IpAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address of the PLC or ENET/ENBT module.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.CpuSlot
member.summary: Gets or sets the slot number of the CPU in the backplane. Default is 0 (typically the leftmost slot).
member.remarks: For CompactLogix, this is typically 0. For ControlLogix, this depends on your chassis configuration.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.Backplane
member.summary: Gets or sets the backplane number. Default is 1 (standard for most configurations).

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets the PLC model type. Default is ControlLogix which works for most Logix PLCs.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.DefaultPollingIntervalMs
member.summary: Gets or sets the default polling interval in milliseconds for active tag groups. Can be overridden per-subscription via attributes.
member.remarks: Recommended values: - 50-100ms for fast-changing process data - 500-1000ms for slow-changing status data - 1000-5000ms for configuration/diagnostics

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.ConnectionTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection timeout in seconds.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.TransactionTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction timeout in seconds. Applied to read/write operations.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.AutoReconnect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to automatically reconnect on connection loss.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.MaxReconnectDelaySeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum delay between reconnection attempts in seconds. Uses exponential backoff starting from 1 second.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.SimulateMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable simulation mode. When true, no actual PLC communication occurs.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.NotifyOnRemoteDisconnect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to notify on remote disconnect. When true, the connection will fire events if the PLC closes the connection.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.EdgePlcDriverOptions.RoutePath
member.summary: Gets the route path in ASComm IoT format: "IP,Backplane,Slot"
member.remarks: Example: "192.168.1.10,1,0" means: - Connect to 192.168.1.10 - Through backplane 1 (port 1) - To CPU in slot 0

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.PlcModel
member.summary: Allen-Bradley PLC model types supported by Edge PLC Driver (via ASComm IoT library).

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.PlcModel.ControlLogix
member.summary: ControlLogix and CompactLogix PLCs (default).

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.PlcModel.Micro800
member.summary: Micro800 series PLCs (Micro820, Micro830, Micro850, Micro870, Micro880).

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.PlcModel.SoftLogix
member.summary: SoftLogix emulator.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.Configuration.PlcModel.GuardPLC
member.summary: GuardPLC safety controller.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ExampleUdtTemplates
member.summary: Example UDT classes showing how to define structures for PLC communication. Copy and modify these examples for your own UDT definitions.
member.remarks: IMPORTANT RULES FOR UDT CLASSES: 1. MUST use [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)] attribute 2. MUST use public FIELDS (not properties) 3. Fields MUST be in the EXACT ORDER as the PLC UDT definition 4. Initialize arrays and nested types in the field declaration 5. Use correct .NET types that map to Logix types

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.MachineStatusUdt
member.summary:
Example: Simple UDT with primitive types.
RSLogix/Studio 5000 UDT Definition: Name: MACHINE_STATUS Members: running BOOL Decimal faulted BOOL Decimal speed REAL Float count DINT Decimal errorCode INT Decimal

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.MachineStatusUdt.running
member.summary: Indicates if the machine is currently running.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.MachineStatusUdt.faulted
member.summary: Indicates if the machine is in a faulted state.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.MachineStatusUdt.speed
member.summary: Current speed of the machine.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.MachineStatusUdt.count
member.summary: Production count value.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.MachineStatusUdt.errorCode
member.summary: Error code if the machine is faulted.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.HourlyDataUdt
member.summary:
Example: UDT with arrays.
RSLogix/Studio 5000 UDT Definition: Name: HOURLY_DATA Members: active BOOL Decimal hourlyCount INT[24] Decimal totalRate REAL Float

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.HourlyDataUdt.active
member.summary: Indicates if hourly data collection is active.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.HourlyDataUdt.hourlyCount
member.summary: Array of 24 hourly count values. Array MUST be initialized.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.HourlyDataUdt.totalRate
member.summary: Total production rate.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductInfoUdt
member.summary:
Example: UDT with STRING type.
RSLogix/Studio 5000 UDT Definition: Name: PRODUCT_INFO Members: productCode STRING batchNumber DINT Decimal weight REAL Float description STRING

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductInfoUdt.productCode
member.summary: Product code string. STRING must be initialized.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductInfoUdt.batchNumber
member.summary: Batch number for this product.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductInfoUdt.weight
member.summary: Weight of the product.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductInfoUdt.description
member.summary: Product description string. STRING must be initialized.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.WorkCellUdt
member.summary:
Example: Nested UDTs (UDT containing another UDT).
RSLogix/Studio 5000 UDT Definition: Name: WORK_CELL Members: cellId DINT Decimal machine1 MACHINE_STATUS machine2 MACHINE_STATUS totalOutput DINT Decimal

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.WorkCellUdt.cellId
member.summary: Unique identifier for this work cell.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.WorkCellUdt.machine1
member.summary: Status of machine 1. Nested UDT must be initialized.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.WorkCellUdt.machine2
member.summary: Status of machine 2. Nested UDT must be initialized.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.WorkCellUdt.totalOutput
member.summary: Total output from this work cell.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductionLineUdt
member.summary:
Example: UDT with array of UDTs.
RSLogix/Studio 5000 UDT Definition: Name: PRODUCTION_LINE Members: lineId STRING cells WORK_CELL[4] efficiency REAL Float

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductionLineUdt.lineId
member.summary: Production line identifier string.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductionLineUdt.cells
member.summary: Array of work cells. Array of UDTs - MUST initialize each element.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.ProductionLineUdt.efficiency
member.summary: Overall efficiency of the production line.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.SampleDataUdt
member.summary: Example: UDT matching a sample active data structure. Shows complex nested structures with multiple levels.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.SampleDataUdt.sampleId
member.summary: Unique identifier for this sample.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.SampleDataUdt.sampledOn
member.summary: Timestamp when the sample was taken.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.SampleDataUdt.sampledBy
member.summary: Identifier of who or what took the sample.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.PositionDataUdt
member.summary: Example: Position data structure.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.PositionDataUdt.xLocMm
member.summary: X coordinate location in millimeters.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.PositionDataUdt.yLocMm
member.summary: Y coordinate location in millimeters.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.PositionDataUdt.zLocMm
member.summary: Z coordinate location in millimeters.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.PositionDataUdt.thetaLocDeg
member.summary: Theta angle location in degrees.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.AnalysisResultUdt
member.summary: Example: Analysis result structure.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.AnalysisResultUdt.measurementStatus
member.summary: Status code of the measurement.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.AnalysisResultUdt.result
member.summary: Result value of the analysis.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.CompleteSampleUdt
member.summary: Example: Complete sample with position and analysis.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.CompleteSampleUdt.site
member.summary: Site identifier where the sample was taken.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.CompleteSampleUdt.lotNumber
member.summary: Lot number for this sample.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.CompleteSampleUdt.position
member.summary: Position data where the sample was taken.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.CompleteSampleUdt.analysis
member.summary: Analysis results for this sample.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixDataTypes
member.summary: Provides utilities for working with Logix data types.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixDataTypes.GetDotNetType(Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixTagType)
member.summary: Maps .NET types to their Logix PLC equivalents.
member.remarks: Type mapping table: - BOOL → Boolean (4 bytes in UDT context) - SINT → SByte (1 byte) - INT → Int16 (2 bytes) - DINT → Int32 (4 bytes) - LINT → Int64 (8 bytes) - USINT → Byte (1 byte) - UINT → UInt16 (2 bytes) - UDINT → UInt32 (4 bytes) - ULINT → UInt64 (8 bytes) - REAL → Single/float (4 bytes) - LREAL → Double (8 bytes) - STRING → LogixString (88 bytes default)

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixDataTypes.GetLogixType(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the Logix tag type from a .NET type.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixDataTypes.GetTypeSize(Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixTagType)
member.summary: Gets the size in bytes of a Logix data type.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixUdtBase
member.summary: Base class for User-Defined Types (UDTs) with proper structure layout. Inherit from this class and apply [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)] attribute.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString
member.summary: Represents a Logix STRING type for PLC communication. Equivalent to the native STRING type in Allen-Bradley PLCs.
member.remarks:
The LOGIX_STRING structure consists of: - 4 bytes (Int32) for string length - 82 bytes for string data (default capacity) - 2 bytes padding (total 88 bytes)
This class must use [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)] and public fields to work correctly with ASComm's GetStructuredValues/Write methods.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.stringLength
member.summary: The actual length of the string (not the capacity).

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.stringData
member.summary: The string data buffer. Default capacity is 82 bytes. Change the array dimension for custom string types in RSLogix.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.Capacity
member.summary: Gets the maximum capacity of this string in characters.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the string value.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new empty LogixString with default capacity (82 bytes).

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new LogixString with a specified capacity.
member.param: The maximum string length in bytes.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new LogixString initialized with a value.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string value of this LOGIX_STRING.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.SetString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the string value.
member.exception: Thrown when the string length exceeds the buffer capacity.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.op_Implicit(Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString)~System.String
member.summary: Implicit conversion from LogixString to string.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString.op_Implicit(System.String)~Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString
member.summary: Implicit conversion from string to LogixString.

member.summary: Represents a custom-length Logix STRING type. Use this for STRING types with non-standard capacity defined in RSLogix.

member.summary: The actual length of the string.

member.name: F:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.DataTypes.LogixString`1.stringData
member.summary: The string data buffer.

member.summary: Creates a new LogixString with the capacity defined by TCapacity.

member.summary: Gets or sets the string value.

member.summary: Sets the string value.

member.summary: Interface for defining custom string capacities.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriver
member.summary: Edge PLC Driver implementation for Allen-Bradley/ControlLogix PLCs. Provides high-level abstractions for PLC communication using ASComm IoT library from Automated Solutions.
member.remarks: Supports: - ControlLogix, CompactLogix, GuardPLC, SoftLogix, Micro800 families - Primitive types (BOOL, INT, DINT, REAL, etc.) - User-Defined Types (UDTs/structures) - Arrays and string types - Polling and DataChanged event subscriptions

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverBuilder
member.summary: Builder for configuring and creating Edge PLC Driver connections.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverBuilder.Create
member.summary: Creates a new Edge PLC Driver builder.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverBuilder.WithLoggerFactory(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory)
member.summary: Configures the logger factory for logging.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverBuilder.Build
member.summary: Builds the Edge PLC Driver with the configured options.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverPublisher
member.summary: Publisher implementation for writing tags to PLCs via Edge PLC Driver.
member.remarks: Supports writing: - Primitive values (BOOL, INT, DINT, REAL, etc.) - Arrays - User-Defined Types (UDTs/structures)

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverPublisher.SetChannel(AutomatedSolutions.ASCommStd.AB.Logix.Net.Channel)
member.summary: Sets the ASComm IoT channel for direct writes.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.EdgePlcDriverPublisher.SetDevice(AutomatedSolutions.ASCommStd.AB.Logix.Device)
member.summary: Sets the ASComm IoT device for direct writes.

member.summary: Sets the write function (injected by EdgePlcDriver after initialization).

member.summary: Writes a UDT/structure value to a tag.
member.param: The tag name in the PLC.

member.summary: Writes an array of values to a tag.

member.summary: Event context implementation for Edge PLC Driver connections. Provides read and write access to PLC tags during event handling.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Tag reader implementation for Edge PLC Driver connections. Used by the EventMediator to read tags specified in [EdgePlcDriverRead] attributes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Edge PLC Driver connection to use for reading.

member.name: T:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver
member.summary: Represents an Edge PLC Driver for communicating with Allen-Bradley ControlLogix PLCs. Provides high-level abstractions for read, write, and subscription operations.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver.Publisher
member.summary: Gets the Edge PLC Driver-specific publisher for writing tags to the PLC.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver.IpAddress
member.summary: Gets the IP address of the connected PLC.

member.name: P:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver.RoutePath
member.summary: Gets the route path to the PLC (IP,Backplane,Slot format).

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver.ReadTagAsync``1(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reads a tag value from the PLC.
member.typeparam: The expected type of the tag value.
member.param: The name of the tag to read.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver.ReadTagsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reads multiple tag values from the PLC in a single operation.
member.param: The names of the tags to read.
member.returns: A dictionary of tag names to their values.

member.name: M:Conduit.EdgePlcDriver.IEdgePlcDriver.ReadTagsAsync``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reads multiple tag values of the same type from the PLC in a single operation. This overload provides type-safety when all tags are known to be the same type.
member.typeparam: The expected type of all tag values.
member.param: The names of the tags to read.
member.returns: A dictionary of tag names to their strongly-typed values.

member.summary: Writes a value to a PLC tag.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to write.
member.param: The name of the tag to write.

member.summary: Writes multiple tag values to the PLC in a single operation.
member.param: Dictionary of tag names to values.

member.summary: Dynamically subscribes to tag changes.
member.typeparam: The expected type of the tag value.
member.param: The tag name to subscribe to.
The handler to invoke when the tag value changes.
member.returns: A disposable subscription that can be used to unsubscribe.
